CalISO Participating Load Stakeholder Meeting Sept th and V endor Fair Sept st Cc ISO will be hosting a Participating Load Stakeholder meeting on September at the ISO The meeting is a broad stakeholder meeting to help refine our load participation programs for Much of the day will be committed to presentations and discussions on lessons learned from and proposals for including technical standards contractual issues and load management Some vendors have approached the ISO with systems that would aggregate loads give them an opportunity to curtail based on day ahead energy prices and provide the curtailment instructions and verifications This type of program may be ultimately sold to ESPs or IOUs In order to accelerate the testing of such systems the ISO may sponsor a pilot program to test the systemapproach with selected vendors The pilot program will test the concepts the interfaces and assist in bringing together vendors ESPs SCs and the IOUs as we move forward toward improving demand responsiveness in our markets We have reserved about hours in the afternoon to allow vendors to present their approaches to the stakeholder group In addition we welcome you to visit a vendor fair that the ISO is hosting on September The ISO has experienced considerable interest from the market place in such a vendor fair that would include entities providing Data Processing Gateway technology for both Generators and Loads in the Participating Ancillary Services Load Program This effort is being encouraged to develop multiple solutions pertaining to installations of direct telemetry for Generators and Load providing Ancillary Services to the ISO markets The agendas are attached for both events including directions and lodging information Please RSVP by September to Sue Happ at Thank you AGENDA timelinesdoc AGENDA timelinesdoc Lodging and Directionspdf Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto AGENDA timelinesdoc AGENDA timelinesdoc Lodging and Directionspdf

CAISO Notification Demand Relief Program Settlement Charge TypesPST This is a reminder that the Summer ISO Demand Relief Program charges are reflected on the June statements and June invoices As announced previously this year the ISO has developed a Summer Demand Relief Program DRP The program is designed to provide an additional level of demand reduction on the ISO system that can be implemented during a stage Emergency in an effort to prevent involuntary load curtailments or rotating blackouts associated with a Stage Emergency Similar to last years program the same charge types are utilized for capacity Charge Type and described in the first link below Two new Charge Types and have been created for the energy payment and allocation when contracted loads are called upon to curtail described in the second link below Although the program was initiated in June no calls were made to curtail load therefore charges and were not utilized The periods in which the Demand Relief Program was called upon to initiate interruptions of contracted loads can be found at the third link below Charge Types and Description docsadadpdf Charge Types and Description docsadadpdf DRP Load Curtailments docsadadpdf Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator

FW Plant Outage ListPlease find attached a list of ISO resource IDs and the associated common name Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From mailto Sent Monday April AM To Cc Subject Plant Outage List I am waiting for a response to an email I sent month ago regarding your database of facilities used to generate the daily plant outage list I would like to cross reference the outage information you provide with other data from other sources and would like an efficient way to join the data It would be helpful to me if I had a table of plants showing your text name and a unique ISO or WSCC identifying code I can be reached at for any questions regarding this request Thank you Mathew Smith Generator resource IDsxls

FW QuestionsNonPrivilegedpst I just sent this and should have copied you on this also Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Thursday May AM To Foster Chris Cc Comnes Alan Williams Bill III Subject RE Questions Here is a version with more answers Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Thursday May AM To Foster Chris Almeida Keoni Cc Comnes Alan Williams Bill III Subject RE Question See inserted comments in parentheses Restating what I think you have indicated below biomass generators are not required to submit heat rate data correct but they are included in the FERC Order Program in that any excess capacity is bid in to the ISO at a price of Is that correct You are required to offer all available capacity to the ISO but the ISO will only insert a standing bid for those units that we have good data as to their available generation ie major PGA units Can they submit heat rate data if they want so a proxy price north of Proxy bid price are only calculated for gasfired units If they dont want to be a price taker ie have a bid of they simply need to bid their available capacity into the realtime market at whatever bid price they feel is appropriate Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From mailto Sent Thursday May AM To Cc Subject RE Question K Yes it is contradictory Restating what I think you have indicated below biomass generators are not required to submit heat rate data but they are included in the FERC Order Program in that any excess capacity is bid in to the ISO at a price of Is that correct Can they submit heat rate data if they want so a proxy price north of C Original Message From Almeida Keoni ENRON mailtoIMCEANOTESAlmeidaCKeoniCKAlmeidacaisoEcomE NRONcom Sent Wednesday May PM To Almeida Keoni Foster Chris H Subject RE Question Q Are biomass and other renewable Generators subject to the mustoffer requirement What if gas is a supplemental fuel for solar As stated in any nonhydroelectric Generating Unit that is located in California and from which energy or capacity is either I sold through any market operated by the ISO or ii transmitted over the ISO controlled grid are subject to the mustoffer requirement The FERC Order does not exempt renewables other than hydro This may sound like it is contradicting the the response below however it indicates that we will not use a proxy price but rather we will submit a zero bid in if you do not already have a bid in and you have available capacity I will verify Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Wednesday May AM To Foster Chris Subject Question Are biomass and other renewable Generators subject to the mustoffer requirement What if gas is a supplemental fuel for solar No The gas is not their primary source Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto FERCorderQuestionsdoc

FW Procedure for Implementing ISOFERCNonPrivilegedpst This is a draft work in progress only Sorry for sending bits and pieces but please realize we had a very short time frame in implementing the FERC Order The folks I have working on these questions are from Market Analysis Legal Comliance Operations and my Grandmother Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Casey Keith Sent Wednesday May PM To Almeida Keoni Leuze Eric Greenleaf Steve Price Jim Rothleder Mark Atkins Sean Hildebrandt Eric Subject RE Procedure for Implementing ISOFERC Keoni Many of these questions require input from others so I am circulating the document to a wider group with my comments included Keith Summertime ProgramKCdoc Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Wednesday May AM To Casey Keith Leuze Eric Subject FW Procedure for Implementing ISOFERC Per Keith Im sending this to get some answers Thanks Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Wednesday May AM To Price Jim Subject Procedure for Implementing ISOFERC File Summertime Programdoc Can you answer the questions that you are able to Thanks Summertime ProgramKCdoc

March Preliminary Invoice Cc NonPrivilegedpst The ISO Settlements group has determined that based on the available information the Market payment amount by Enron should be due on May by am This is based on the adjusted meter data submitted by Enron between and final settlement statements that have been generated only to March th which has updated the preliminary statements to this date Along with this we have calculated that the GMC payment should be Please note that any trueups to the exact settlement statement charges will be reflected in the final settlement statements for the dates in which we had to trend through Adjusted Payment Charges will be made within the normal market mechanisms Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

FW Dispute Trade Dates NonPrivilegedpst Good news See email below Epstein is our Controller Spence is our Director of Settlements Bill Regan is our Chief Financial Officer On another note it has been requested that a detailed explanation be given and what will be done to prevent this in the future I hope you can understand the reasoning for this request Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Epstein Michael Sent Thursday May PM To Gerber Spence Woertz Byron Almeida Keoni Nelsen Deanne Cc Perez Glen Regan William Iverson Melodie Subject RE Dispute Trade Dates Importance High The ISO would like Enron to pay the net amount after Spence has made his estimate of the corrected bill We will not be able to tell Enron the amount until early next week Keoni needs to inform Enron to pay the adjusted amount when Spences estimate is complete

FERC order implementationNonPrivilegedpst FERC MIFAppt This was from the Market Issues Forum A lot of details are being hammered out I will let you know once they come available Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto FERC MIFAppt

FW Enron Data for March NonPrivilegedpst Per my phone message Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Alvarez David Sent Wednesday May PM To Perez Glen Cc Almeida Keoni Subject Enron Data for March Glen Attached is a spreadsheet for the month of March As you can see Enron seems to be reporting more load with the Meter Data Change that came in today for March to March The first column on the spreadsheet shows the data submitted prior to the Meter Data Change Request The second column in each territory shows the changes requested by Enron The dashes within the spreadsheet indicate zero data reported for that day Enron March xls David Alvarez Data Quality Enron March xls

ConfirmationNonPrivilegedpst I received confirmation The Soft cap at was effective on and the soft cap at was effective on Sorry for the confusion but there are so many changes going on its hard to keep up Here is another market notice with further clarification on allocation Original Message From CRCommunications Sent Wednesday January PM To SC Settlements Contacts Cc ISO Market Participants Subject CAISO Notification New Charge Types Soft Cap Effective trade day December pursuant to Amendment the ISO will allocate the amount paid to purchase Energy above the soft price cap and for energy procured outofmarket to those Scheduling Coordinators who underschedule load or overschedule generation The ISO has developed the following two new Charge Types for these Settlements CT Soft Cap Payment to SCs The ISO will compensate Instructed Energy providers for energy instructed at a price above the MCP in two parts The amount of instructed energy delivered will be compensated in Charge Type at the interval MCP The difference between the interval MCP and the bid in price above the soft cap will be compensated in Charge Type CT Soft Cap Cost Allocation to Market The total payments made by ISO in charge type will be allocated on a regional basis to SCs based on their net negative Uninstructed Energy in the corresponding region through Charge Type Units providing Regulation are exempted from the charge type The supporting details for charge type and will be provided in the InstructedUninstructed Energy Detail Records in the Imbalance EnergyNo Pay Settlement Detail File The Uninstructed energy file contains a new section called Excess Cost section These statement file changes are reflected in version a of the Settlement Statement File Specification which was distributed to TSWG and SC Settlements Contacts January Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

RE Soft Cap allocation Cc NonPrivilegedpst I will check on this I may be incorrect in the date based on the following quoted response that I found I will get further clarification In its November Order FERC outlined a series of flaws in the California markets and proposed a number of measured designed to reform the market One of such proposals what that the ISO modify its single price auction so that bids above MWh could not set the market clearing price that is paid to all bidders and imposing certain reporting and monitoring requirements for transactions and bids above the MWh breakpoint Pursuant to FERCs November Order the ISO filed Amendment with FERC on December which was approved on the same day On December FERC issued an Order Directing Remedies for California Wholesale Electric Markets and further clarified its December Order Pursuant to Amendment effective December FERC authorized the ISO to set a soft bid cap for the purchase of realtime energy The order specified that although the ISO would pay those entities bidding above the soft cap as bid all bids above the breakpoint would be are subject to market refund following FERCs review of the bid data in order to ensure just and reasonable rates Effective December FERCs order authorized the ISO to assess the costs of realtime purchases above the soft cap and allocate to SCs which underschedule load the difference between the interval MCP and the bid price above the soft cap bid prices to SCs which underschedule load The ISO created CT to accomplish this allocation Please see the following excerpt from the FERC December order Docket No EL et al On December the ISO filed Tariff Amendment No in Docket No ER seeking expedited consideration of tariff revisions to address emergency reliability conditions The filing sought three modification of the ISOs tariff immediate implementation of an interim price mitigation proposal based on the breakpoint concept that was proposed in the November Order at MWh to encourage greater participation of generators in its markets provision of penalties on generators that fail to respond to dispatch instructions during a system emergency to become effective December and allocation of the costs of obtaining additional energy to Scheduling Coordinators who rely on the ISOs realtime Imbalance Energy market as an incentive to loads to purchase energy in the forward markets The ISO requested an effective date of December for the third modification The commission approved the tariff revisions in an order issued December with the effective dates requested by the ISO After an extensive review the ISO has concluded that the charges for purchases above the soft cap break point currently set at mwh although high are consistent with the filing approved by FERC FERC continues to review the just and reasonableness of all bids dispatched in our realtime market that are above the breakpoint and will order market refund if the dispatched bid price is not found to be just and reasonable The ISO continues to review this issue and is considering alternative allocation methods which would continue to be consistent with the tariff Keoni FW Enron data for trade date forwardNonPrivilegedpst Chris if you want I can handle this with George directly Let me know Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Alvarez David Sent Monday May AM To Almeida Keoni Cc Perez Glen Plumley Jeanette Jaschke Allen Subject Enron data for trade date forward Keoni Looking at Enrons data for trade days it seems that data from trade day March has gone up from Mwh per hour to Mwh per hour I left a message with Chris Stokley while we were down in Alhambra on Wednesday but have not heard from him I have enclosed a graphic of several months for comparison as well as data for that same period Please take a look at data from on If they need to make a change I would suggest making a change for first then doing changes for and days afterwards Let me know if you have any questions Enron doc Enron dataxls Thanks David Alvarez Data Quality Enron doc Enron dataxls

RE CR Communication Rerun schedule for May Cc NonPrivilegedpst I have a request in for clarification however I believe that these are the scheduled reruns for settlements for postfinal disputes that require reruns For example your August and disputes that have yet to be adjusted are scheduled for adjustment on June th Not all postfinal disputes need a market rerun therefore some of your postfinal disputes may be done on an earlier date Once they do I will be notified and then I will in turn let you know At any rate I will make sure my assumption here is correct Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From mailto Sent Tuesday April AM To Subject Re CR Communication Rerun schedule for May Keoni What is this Are there any details available Thanks Donna CRCommunications on AM To SC Settlements Contacts IMCEAEXOCAISOOUCORPORATECNDISTRIBUTIONLISTSCN aisocom cc ISO Client Relations ISO Settlements IMCEAEXOCAISOOUCORPORATECNDISTRIBUTIONLISTSCN m Subject CR Communication Rerun schedule for May Important Notice Rerun Schedule for May Below is the Settlements rerun schedule for the month of May May for Trade Date January to May for Trade Date January to May for Trade Date May to June June for Trade Date June to June June for Trade Date June to July June for Trade Date July to July June for Trade Date July to August June for Trade Date August to August Client Relations Communication

FW Removal of Settlement statements from the SI Unix box and eff ective statement retrieval request charges Cc NonPrivilegedpst Donna can you please respond that you are willing to pay for the statements as listed in the email below and Settlements will arrange to post the statements Thanks Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From CRCommunications Sent Thursday August PM To SC Settlements Contacts Cc Fenstermacher Stephen Subject Removal of Settlement statements from the SI Unix box and effective statement retrieval request charges Notification In an effort to free up disk space the ISO will be removing Settlement Statement files from the SI Unix machine where SCs currently download their settlement statements files from Currently the ISOs SI computer systems have Preliminary Settlements Statements PSS dating back to January th and Final Settlements Statements FSS dating back to January rd available for SCs to download On Wednesday September st Invoices for the month of June will be produced On that date Preliminary Settlement Statements PSS prior to April th and Final Settlement Statements FSS prior to March th will be removed from the SI computer system and will NOT be available for downloading The CAISO advises all SCs to download statements with dates older than those mentioned above prior to Wednesday if they have not done so already Also effective immediately the ISO is instituting a policy of charging SCs for retrieving statements that have already been removed from the system A minimum of days worth of statements will be maintained online After statements have been archived and removed from the system the ISO will charge for the first two statements retrieved and for each additional statement retrieved A statement is defined as the statement and all of that statements supplemental files ie the GM GI DU AS files Preliminary and Final Statements are considered two separate statements As an example if a SC wanted their Preliminary Final Statements for April st and nd they would be charged a total of If you have any questions please dont hesitate to contact your Client Relations Representative CRCommunications Client Relations Communications
Check out A and B it is MWNonPrivilegedpst docsabeabepdf Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

FW GCP Phases Requirements NoticeNonPrivilegedpst See second paragraph Im still looking to see if the changed this requirement or what the outcome of what is suggested below Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Happ Susan On Behalf Of Fuller Don Sent Tuesday September AM To GCP Market Participants ISO Market Participants Subject GCP Phases Requirements Notice Market Participants and GCP Market Participants Since startup the ISO has been obligated to gain direct communications access to Generating Units in the ISO Control Area subject to existing contractual arrangements Initially the investorowned utility IOU Control Centers and ICCP links were utilized on an interim basis to provide this capability until the ISO could establish the communications links that would facilitate direct communications to the Generating Units This communication link is vital for all resources including Generating Units and loads that provide Ancillary Services AS to the ISO The ISO and Market Participants began the Generator Communications Project in to develop standards equipment and communications protocols to provide this link The initial focus was on Generating Units providing Regulation Generating Units that provide Regulation to the ISO must have a Remote Intelligent Gateway RIG unit which provides the ISO direct AGC control of the Generating Unit as well as direct communication The RIG installation at those units satisfies the requirements of this Notice With that phase of the installation almost complete the next phase of the program has started to establish the communications links for all resources providing Ancillary Services Currently Loads greater than MW can provide Ancillary Services and Generating Units over MW can provide AS The ISO is currently considering lowering the floor for Generating Units providing Ancillary Services from MW to MW This will require all remaining resources providing Ancillary Services to install by June an ISOapproved direct communication system for its affected Generating Units for telemetry to the ISO Energy Management System EMS The ISO currently has approved the Data Processing Gateway DPG technology for such direct telemetry Thus each affected Generator and Load must install a DPG for its Generating Units or Loads that may provide Ancillary Services other than Regulation unless it requests and receives ISO approval for the use of an alternative technology Of course Generating Units that provide Regulation to the ISO must have a Remote Intelligent Gateway RIG unit which provides the ISO direct AGC control of the Generating Unit as well as direct communication As announced initially by the ISO at the February Generators meeting for the ISOs Generator Communications Project GCP and reiterated most recently at the July GCP meeting the work required to install and test the DPG or ISOapproved alternative technology and to undertake recertification of the capability of the Generating Units to provide Ancillary Services to the ISO must be completed by June After that date Generating Units that do not use the DPG or other ISOapproved technology may be precluded from supplying Ancillary Services to the ISO The ISO will provide a formal notice of the foregoing requirements by a letter to each Participating Generator If you have any questions or concerns about the requirement to install and use a DPG or ISOapproved alternative technology please feel free to call Ernest Senior of ISO Operations Systems or the ISO Client Representative for the Generator Communications Project Dave Timson Don Fuller Director Client Relations NOTE In order for the ISO to make appropriate accommodations for the interconnection between the ISOs EMS and DPGs for all Generating Units supplying Ancillary Services other than Regulation to the ISO the ISO will be requesting that Generators provide an installation schedule applicable to each affected Generating Unit We intend to issue the request for DPG installation schedules by October

FW CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand PenaltyNonPrivilegedpst I think this is a good example to go off of Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From CRCommunications Sent Friday February PM To ISO Market Participants SC Settlements Contacts Cc Gerber Spence Shafa Masoud ISO Client Relations Subject CAISO NotificationUnscheduled Demand Penalty The Unscheduled Demand Penalty was ordered by FERC in its December order to be effective on January Trade Date The ISO is filing a request with FERC to suspend this penalty Additionally SCE and PGE have jointly filed at FERC requesting suspension of the penalty Until FERC provides direction and clarification ISO will calculate the Unscheduled Demand Penalty charges and credits but will not include them in the settlement statements There is no impact to any other charges or payments since the penalty and the allocation of the proceeds is self contained Attached is a description of the Unscheduled Demand Penalty Unscheduled Demand Penaltydoc CRCommunications Client Relations Communications Unscheduled Demand Penaltydoc

FW KTISO Mkt Stabilization Plan call NonPrivilegedpst Folks because of the many meetings that take place and the difficulty of staying on top of all the separate issues I thought I would forward to FW CAISO Notice Market Stabilization PlanNonPrivilegedpst I have not had time to really delve into the details of the plan but thought I would let you know that the Market Stabilization Plan will have a big impact on your business practices just as minute settlements did We realize the pain minute settlements brought and continues to bring and weve expressed that any future changes needs to be done in a more pragmatic manner I can only keep my fingers crossed Anyway the implementation date is June so I thought I would send this out as a heads up Im also attached the filing Keep in mind that this is a detailed narrative and the ISO believes that FERC will issue its order regarding market power mitigation within the next weeks which would incorporate their review of the narrative filing Specific tariff language would then be completed and filed ISO MSP filing pdf ISO MSP filing Attach A pdf ISO MSP filing Attach B summer assesspdf Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Happ Susan Sent Monday April AM To ISO Market Participants Subject CAISO Notice Market Stabilization Plan Importance High ISO Market Participants The ISO Market Stabilization Plan filed with FERC on Friday April is available for review on the ISO web site at pubinforecenthtml Sent on behalf of Byron B Woertz Jr Director Client Relations Pager ISO MSP filing pdf ISO MSP filing Attach A pdf ISO MSP filing Attach B summer assesspdf

Enron chargesNonPrivilegedpst Keonizip Chris per your request here are the and charges that have been tracked to date for Enron Please keep in mind that the systems have not been built to incorporate this data into our Settlements process so the normal validations built into our Settlements process are not applied to the manual tracking of these charges Therefore this data should not be considered Settlement quality If these charges ever to become effective the proper systems will be built to pull in this data into the Settlement process I checked with some folks and found out that FERC should rule on this during September Take care Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

FW Enron invoicing problems Cc NonPrivilegedpst Ill let you know what the outcome of this mess will be Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Wednesday June AM To Iverson Melodie Leiber Phil Gerber Spence Nelsen Deanne Subject Enron invoicing problems Importance High How are we reconciling Enrons preliminary invoice with the final invoice We told them to only pay million which they did on the prelim even though the market invoice was for million But the attached invoice indicates that the market OWES them million on the final indicating that we did not factor out the correction In addition we had them pay for GMC on the prelim when the actual invoice was for Now the final is showing that the ISO OWES them Please advise Thanks MarchFinalpdf MarchFinalgmcpdf Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto MarchFinalpdf MarchFinalgmcpdf

FW April Preliminary AS Offset for High Prices Cc NonPrivilegedpst See note below This is a mess Im trying to get what the prices should be for the error referenced below That way you can take the correct price figure out what your AS obligation and payment should be and pay that accordingly This suggestion is not recommended by the ISO as the ISO expects the market to pay their invoices in whole however when we only pay two cents on the dollar this is an alternative that you may want to consider Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Almeida Keoni Sent Wednesday June AM To Klussmann Rhonda ISO Client Relations ISO Settlements Market Quality Group Subject RE April Preliminary AS Offset for High Prices My apologies for asking this again Can you please provide to us with what hours are impacted and what the prices should be Thanks Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Klussmann Rhonda Sent Tuesday June PM To ISO Client Relations ISO Settlements Market Quality Group Subject April Preliminary AS Offset for High Prices On Trade Date unintentional high prices ranging from to per MW were generated for Spin CT HE and NonSpin CT HE This also caused irrational Rational Buyer Neutrality charges CT Of course the prices will be corrected on the Final Statement but market defaults have raised concerns about overcharging on the Preliminary Invoice the inability to collect for payments on the Final Invoice and the interest penalty that follows Since the dollar impact is significant around M an offset will be entered in time for the April Preliminary Invoice The manual delta paymentscredits when netted against the original charges will equate to a more reasonable charge CT adjustments are based upon net obligation and a delta price bad price minus what the wt ave price should have been CT adjustment were backed into and will be impossible to validate due to changes in CT amounts The AS adjustment will be entered on Preliminary Statement and reversed on the Final Statement Please notify your clients appropriately Rhonda Klussmann Sr MQ Analyst

From Almeida Keoni Sent Wednesday May PM To Ford Greg Subject FW Question My response to the questions would be that they get the proxy price during the mitigated intervals when they do not have a bid in If they have a bid in they get the higher of the proxy or the bid and they submit the cost justification to FERC Right Who do they send cost justification to Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Foster Chris H mailtoChrisH NRONcom Sent Wednesday May PM To Cc Scott Hawley Email Cocke Jr Stanley Comnes Alan Subject FW Question Keoni In addition to my questions below can you clarify what we get paid when we are incd pursuant to the FERC Order Is the proxy the inc If we do not have a bid in do we get the inc If we have a supplemental bid in do we get the higher of the inc or the bid If we do get the higher of to whom do we send our cost data Chris Original Message From Foster Chris H Sent Wednesday May PM To Almeida Keoni ENRON Cc Nelson Kourtney Comnes Alan Stokley Chris Subject RE Question K I wanted to document what just happened on receiving a dispatch instruction from the ISO for Harbor Cogen harbgnunits At we received a dispatch instruction from he ISO due to the Stage emergency The request was for MW from Tosco and MW from Harbor As you know we are no longer the SC for Tosco and have sent you the required documentation Can you make sure the ISO has this in their system With respect to Harbor we were running MW and were incd indicating a request for a total of MW We already had an approved outage request from the ISO as indicated by the fax I sent you indicating that Harbor only had MW available So the ISO should only have been able to dispatch MW We initially declined the dispatch instruction from the ISO due to the errors the ISO made and the confusion it caused us We immediately hit the phones to clarify the facts and subsequently incd generation to MW by Why did the ISO dispatch group not have our outage request indicating a maximum of MW We believe we have completely responded to the ISOs instruction and should have no penalty charges Please let me know the settlement implications of this confusion event Thanks Chris

CAISO Notification Demand Relief Program Settlement Charge TypesBill NonPrivilegedpst This is a reminder that the Summer ISO Demand Relief Program charges are reflected on the June statements and June invoices As announced previously this year the ISO has developed a Summer Demand Relief Program DRP The program is designed to provide an additional level of demand reduction on the ISO system that can be implemented during a stage Emergency in an effort to prevent involuntary load curtailments or rotating blackouts associated with a Stage Emergency Similar to last years program the same charge types are utilized for capacity Charge Type and described in the first link below Two new Charge Types and have been created for the energy payment and allocation when contracted loads are called upon to curtail described in the second link below Although the program was initiated in June no calls were made to curtail load therefore charges and were not utilized The periods in which the Demand Relief Program was called upon to initiate interruptions of contracted loads can be found at the third link below Charge Types and Description docsadadpdf Charge Types and Description docsadadpdf DRP Load Curtailments docsadadpdf Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator

RE More questions FW ISO Compliance Filing on June FERC Or der Cc Bill NonPrivilegedpst Thanks for sending your input on price transparency I will forward this issue to the group who worked on this filing Send any other questionsconcerns you may have Also keep in mind that there is a conference call next week See attached Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Sheidun Donna mailtodonna NRONcom Sent Wednesday July PM To Subject More questions FW ISO Compliance Filing on June FERC Order Importance High MessageID From Woertz Byron Sender Grant Colleen ReplyTo Woertz Byron To ISO Market Participants IMCEAEXOCAISOOUCORPORATECNDISTRIBUTIONLISTSCN Subject CAISO Notice ISO Compliance Filing on June FERC Order Date Wed Jul Importance high XPriority MIMEVersion XMailer Internet Mail Service ContentType textplain charsetiso ISO Market Participants As you know on June the FERC released its Order On Rehearing Of Monitoring And Mitigation Plan For The California Wholesale Electric Markets Establishing WestWide Mitigation And Establishing Settlement Conference Since the Order was released market participants have raised several questions regarding the Order The ISO has received several questions and plans to share those questions and answers with you within the next few days In addition in compliance with the June FERC Order the ISO has made its compliance filing with FERC The filing is posted on the ISO web site at pubinfoFERCfilings for your review The ISO will host a conference call from pm to pm PDT on Monday July to discuss questions you may have regarding the FERCs June Order The details of the call are as follows DialIn Number Conference ID Leader Byron Woertz Our goal will be to clarify the ways in which the ISO is interpreting and implementing the FERC Order and to address other implementation issues you may have We do not plan to discuss issues that are pending or are more appropriately addressed at FERC If you have specific questions you would like for us to address please send them to me by COB on Thursday July so that we can be better prepared to address them during the call on Monday If you have any questions please call or email me Byron B Woertz Jr Director Client Relations Pager

FERC OrderBill NonPrivilegedpst Bill the price you see in Footnote of the email titled CAISO Notice Correction of FERC June Order Market Notice is the highest hourly expost price during the last Stage The price is of per the FERC Order The last Stage occurred on Trade Date HE and A Stage was in effect from See docsaaaaaxls Emergency Detail tab The Hourly Ex Post Price can be found in OASIS under Button Ex Post Market Information on the CAISO Website The Order indicates that the price should not include a Stage and and even though the cancellation notice of the Stage was not until HE we are going by the strict definition of when the Stage was actually implemented Hope this helps Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto

FW CAISO Notice Correction of FERC June Order Market NoticeBill NonPrivilegedpst Here is the latest which you should of gotten but I wanted to let you know that you find the last Stage at SystemStatushtml under System Status Log and History I am trying to get a conference call set up with our Market Operations folks and Market Participants set up for Friday Keoni Almeida California Independent System Operator phone pager alpha page email mailto Original Message From Happ Susan On Behalf Of Fuller Don Sent Wednesday June PM To ISO Market Participants Subject CAISO Notice Correction of FERC June Order Market Notice Importance High Resending due to the addition of footnotes This is a corrected version MARKET NOTICE For hour ending on June the California ISO will implement the following terms and provisions pursuant to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission FERC June Order concerning market mitigation measures for California and the Western System Coordinating Council FOR HOURS IN WHICH ISO DECLARES A SYSTEM EMERGENCY The ISO Realtime Imbalance Energy minute and Hourly Ex Post prices shall be set in accordance with FERCs April Order as clarified by FERCs June Order The Market Clearing Price MCP for Ancillary Services shall not exceed the Hourly Ex Post Price for the same hour in accordance with FERCs May Order as described in the CAISO Emergency NoticeMay FERC Order On Implementation of the Price Mitigation Plan in April Order FOR HOURS IN WHICH ISO DOES NOT DECLARE A SYSTEM EMERGENCY The ISO Realtime Imbalance Energy MCP shall be no greater than percent of the highest Hourly market clearing price established when the last Stage emergency was in effect The ISO Ancillary Services MCP shall be no greater than percent of the maximum Hourly market clearing price established when the last Stage emergency was in effect APPLICABLE TO ALL HOURS The systemwide gas price utilized to calculate the Proxy Price mandated by the April Order as clarified by the June Order shall be based on the simple average of the Gas Daily midpoint monthly bidweek SoCalGas large package Malin and PGE Citygate prices For June this average is mmBtu The ISO is required to add percent to the MCP paid to generators for all prospective sales in its markets to reflect credit uncertainty The prices posted on the ISO Web Site do not reflect the percent markup Footnotes Capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein are used in the meaning set forth in the Master Definitions Supplement Appendix A to the ISO Tariff The ISO is implementing those provisions for which it can make the requisite system changes immediately and will implement the remaining provisions as soon as possible The maximum MCP for nonemergency hours selling into CAISO markets effective June and until after the next Stage emergency shall be based on the highest hourly MCP during the most recent Stage emergency of MWh The ISO continues to assess the June Order and the steps necessary to implement the Order We will be issuing subsequent Market Notices as may be appropriate with respect to implementation of the June Order CAISO Market Operations
